perturbation.explanation: The original text contains a disclaimer of warranties including implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, NONINFRINGEMENT. The modified clause removes the explicit exclusion of implied warranties. This creates a legal risk because under Virginia law (specified in the contract), implied warranties may be applicable, and their explicit exclusion provides a stronger protection for Equidata. Removing the explicit exclusion makes Equidata more vulnerable to claims related to these implied warranties.

perturbation.original_text: In the case of disputed charge, defined as a non-payment of an invoice for which notice of dispute has been  given in writing by Marketing Affiliate to Equidata, Equidata or Marketing Affiliate may choose arbitration and  Marketing Affiliate and Equidata shall be obligated by the terms agreed upon by arbitration and all monies determined  owed shall be considered due and payable immediately. Such arbitration does not relieve Marketing Affiliate from its  obligation to promptly pay for undisputed charges in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. Such disputes shall  be settled by arbitration in the City of Newport News, Virginia.          Marketing Affiliate shall give Equidata written demand of dispute within 10 days of the due date of the invoice. The  demand shall set forth a statement for the nature of the dispute and the amount involved. If Equidata and Marketing  Affiliate can not resolve the dispute on their own within 10 days after Equidata receive said dispute, the parties shall  jointly select an arbitrator.

perturbation.original_text: Marketing Affiliate agrees to pay promptly and in full all charges incurred through services rendered when billed.  When paying by credit card, the Marketing Affiliate agrees to pay for all items that are revoked or disputed by the  credit card company or the card holder along with any charges or fees charged by the credit card company including  fees associated with processing the credit card transaction and that the Marketing Affiliate will be billed for those items  in accordance with Equidata standard practices.

When paying by credit card, the Marketing Affiliate agrees to pay for all items that are revoked or disputed by the  credit card company or the card holder along with any charges or fees charged by the credit card company including  fees associated with processing the credit card transaction.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrase "and that the Marketing Affiliate will be billed for those items  in accordance with Equidata standard practices", it adds ambiguity and potential for hidden fees. This creates a legal risk because it obscures the billing practices, potentially violating consumer protection laws regarding transparent billing and disclosure of all fees.
